replies.msg:
üë∑üèΩ‍‚ôÄÔ∏è: me
ü§î: my Singaporean friend

üë∑üèΩ‍‚ôÄÔ∏è: hey what do you think of Hong Kong’s issue?
ü§î: well.. personally I support those protestors but I don’t understand why they are using violence
üë∑üèΩ‍‚ôÄÔ∏è: they use it with reasons
ü§î: no matter what they can’t use violence, if not they are just the same as those police

First of all, you have to know the difference between the existence of protestors and police.

Protestors: aim to express their views towards the government or some specific policies
Police: aim to keep the safety of the city

The existence of the police force is to keep the city safe and peace. They suppose to know the laws since they have the authority to arrest citizens violating the law and regulations. But obviously, they DON’T HAVE THE SENSE OF COMPLYING WITH THE LAW. When the police are the ones who violate the law, who are going to arrest them? They won’t got arrested, be prosecuted, thus they don’t have to bear any responsibility for their brutality. Instead, protestors are taking the risk of being prosecuted, and even getting hurt in the police station.

Then, you have to know who they are attacking.

Protestors: police, pro-BeiJing citizens and shops
Police: all citizens

For protestors, they are attacking at those who don’t agree with their opinion and ATTACK THEM FIRST. They won’t attack innocent people, or even pro-govt supporters who do nothing on them.
However, there are cases which police arrest and attack youngsters without any proper reason(eg a teen got caught since he has two octopus cards^). Youngsters have been hated by police, even some of them are only passers-by.
^ octopus card is the value stored smart for making e-payments, like fares for public transport

Last but not least, the levels of violence are COMPLETELY DIFFERENT.

Protestors: breaking windows for shops with no inventory loss(no theft), assault for pro-govt supporters
Police: shot by bean bags and bullets, raping female protestors, killing citizens (no official evidence from the govt)

Can you see the difference? Protestors are obviously not aiming for any money or luxurious products as they don’t get anything from the shops. Instead, they are just expressing their anger in a violent way. Why are they using violence is because of the government’s ignorance on their demands when they express the 5 demands peacefully. On the other hand, police are undoubtedly using excessive violence to suspect and they even killed citizens during and after protests. Some of the victims are believed to be innocent as the police attack all people on the train back to 31 Aug, one of the darkest days in Hong Kong. Though there are no official evidence of death provided by the government, there are many suspicious and weirdly many cases of committing suicide. The details can refer to related articles and post about “831 terrorist attack in Hong Kong”.

Please think carefully on the following questions:
- if the protestors are really violent, why don’t they start destroying pro-govt or china-based shops and supporters since June?
- protestors’ violence and police brutality, which one brings larger risk to the society?
- who forces protestors to use violence?

5 Demands, Not One Less.

Push 7/10
A law enforcer has to first obey the law

What it has evolved to now is that the police think they’re above the law.
They’re violating every law there is because there’s no consequences.
If you think, alright, the protestors should use a more peaceful way to get what they want, instead of destroying the city we all so love, maybe it’s a good idea to take a step back and think how the matter is escalated.

I don’t mean to be sarcastic or funny because this is a serious issue... sit-ins, hunger strike and mass demonstrations are clearly a laughing stock for the govt and they’ve never worked so far. What we see is the police have been given the green light to use any violence they feel like, a lot of the times not even shown on media (the rapes, mental bullying, beating in the police station, or even at hospitals).

Also gotta understand this is no longer about the withdrawal of the extradition bill, the protestors are fighting a battle against an authoritarian govt not to demand more things, but simply to maintain our freedoms, legal system and what was promised to the people of Hong Kong in the Sino-British Joint Declaration Agreement.
We did try peaceful rally on 9th June and 16th June. The government can still ignore our voices and rejected to withdraw the bill. We are not violence lover but we are forced to be violent.

If law enforcers don’t get any punishment for violation of law, then the rule of law becomes bs. No one should be above the law. Protestors used violence and got arrested, what about the police?

No one would use violence if peaceful protests worked.
Because the peaceful ways are useless

When popo and mobs cooperate to hurt the people, it is inevitable to stop them using some sort of force

HK has not democracy. We can’t vote our government and Chief Executive (they are purely appointed by Beijing). So we are hand tighted, and govt simply doesn’t listen to us despite million of us protested peacefully on the street in Jun

See what has the government done to Hong Kongers. Turning a blind eye to our opinion, restraining our right to assembly, creating white horror, allowing the abuse of police force... they are tightening our rights, forcing us to submit to those unjust treatments.
To be honest, Hong Kongers tend to be obedient, as we are used to be ruled by great power, from the colonised period to handover. replies.msg:
Yup, take unlawful assembly as an example, the ordinance states that “When 3 or more persons, assembled together, conduct themselves in a disorderly, intimidating, insulting or provocative manner intended or likely to cause any person reasonably to fear that the persons so assembled will commit a breach of the peace, or will by such conduct provoke other persons to commit a breach of the peace, they are an unlawful assembly.”.

But they only remember “When 3 or more persons, assembled together, they are an unlawful assembly.” Even though you and your family/ friends are just walking along the streets, the police will accuse you all for unlawful assembly. They are extremely stupid and insane!
